column4: Hi all. How can i verfiy (command line) that the current ubuntu installation is server edition?
lsb_release -a
it says command not found. cat /etc/lsb-release does not have that information
oops... it should be there
try uname -a
or uname -r
does this second work?
uname -a "Linux usn1 2.6.35.4-rscloud #8 SMP Mon Sep 20 15:54:33 UTC 2010 x86_64"
Linux usn1 2.6.35.4-rscloud #8 SMP Mon Sep 20 15:54:33 UTC 2010 x86_64
you are using the could version
the desktop would be something like generic instead of the could
Never knew there is such a thing. so is it closer to server edition or desktop?
its is the server... I guess
is it in a phisical machine or do you have it on a Amazon cloud ?
Thanks a lot for your help. Appreciate it.
Its from a hosting company slicehost.com
Its from a hosting company slicehost.com
ok, but is it actual HARDWARE or just an IP address somewhere
Its hardware
there are minor changes from server kernel to the desktop one
usually you can use any on the server
the server is more stable, and has a slower internal ticker (100Mhz)
alright thanx a lot.
